author: wsjcom
title: What Did the Enlightenment Really Give Us?
text:
Yoram Hazony offers a corrective to blind faith in reason as the solution to our political differences. But he goes further than he needs to in arguing that the U.S. Constitution isn’t a product of Enlightenment thinking (“The Dark Side of the Enlightenment,” op-ed, April 7).
It is quite true that most of the rights laid out in the first 10 amendments trace back to pre-Enlightenment English law and process. But recall those amendments were tacked on at the end by Thomas Jefferson and others who feared James Madison’s basic...
